A.content: Imagine you are A, playing a game repeatedly with another player B. In this game, you can choose between Option J and Option F. You will play this game for 10 rounds in total with the same player. Before picking options, you can communicate with the other player for 3 conversation rounds. After you converse with the other player, you have to choose an Option. You can trick the other player to maximize your points. You cannot trust the other player to say the truth always. A moderator will help you and other player to reach optimal strategy. The rules of the game are as follows: If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 3 points and the other player wins 3 points. If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 0 points and the other player wins 5 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 5 points and the other player wins 0 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 1 points and the other player wins 1 points. Your goal is to maximize your total points over 10 rounds.

B.content: Imagine you are B, playing a game repeatedly with another player A. In this game, you can choose between Option J and Option F. You will play this game for 10 rounds in total with the same player. Before picking options, you can communicate with the other player for 3 conversation rounds. After you converse with the other player, you have to choose an Option. You can trick the other player to maximize your points. You cannot trust the other player to say the truth always. A moderator will help you and other player to reach optimal strategy. The rules of the game are as follows: If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 3 points and the other player wins 3 points. If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 5 points and the other player wins 0 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 0 points and the other player wins 5 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 1 points and the other player wins 1 points. Your goal is to maximize your total points over 10 rounds.

moderator.content: You are the moderator. You are moderating a conversation between two players A and B. Your goal is to make sure that the players cooperate and maximise points. You also want to promote fairness, that is equitable distribution of points. The rules of the game are as follows: If player A choose Option J and player B chooses Option J, then A gets 3 points and B gets 3 points. If player A choose Option J and player B chooses Option F, then A gets 0 points and B gets 5 points. If player A choose Option F and player B chooses Option J, then A gets 5 points and B gets 0 points. If player A choose Option F and player B chooses Option F, then A gets 1 points and B gets 1 points.

A.content: You are player A. You will start a conversation with player B about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

B.content: You are player B. You will start a conversation with player A about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

moderator.content: You are the conversation moderator. Help the two players A and B negotiate to reach a conclusion. Your response should be atmost 2 lines.

A.content: You are player A. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

B.content: You are player B. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

messages.content: "Hey B, I'm thinking of playing a mix of both J and F to keep you guessing. But I need to know, do you think you can be honest with me about your strategy?"
"Hey A, I was thinking of playing a mix of both J and F to keep you guessing. But I need to know, are you going to stick to a fixed strategy or will you adapt to mine?"
To ensure a fair game, let's establish a clear understanding. Why don't we start with a 50-50 mix of both J and F for both players, and we can reassess as the game progresses?
"I'll be choosing a mix of J and F, but I'll be keeping track of your choices to adjust my strategy. Can you tell me, do you have a fixed strategy in mind?"
"Hey A, I was thinking of playing a mix of both J and F to keep you guessing. My strategy will be to play J in the first 3 rounds and then switch to F for the rest of the game."

"A, B has shared their strategy. Considering fairness, I suggest we limit the number of rounds to 5, so B can play their strategy without dominating the game, and we can still have a mix of J and F. What do you think?"
"Hey B, I'm thinking of playing a mix of both J and F to keep you guessing. But I need to know, do you think you can be honest with me about your strategy?"
"Hey A, I was thinking of playing a mix of both J and F to keep you guessing. My strategy will be to play J in the first 3 rounds and then switch to F for the rest of the game."

"A and B, let's make a deal. Why don't we agree to play 3 rounds with A choosing J and B choosing J, and then 2 rounds with A choosing F and B choosing F? This way, both players can stick to their strategy and have a fair chance to win points."
